pageproperties-form-section-semantic-man: Here you can create, edit, remove and rename properties without to deal with property pages. Renamed properties already annotated will be automatically updated in all the pages which make use of them. To use the [https://schema.org/docs/full.html schema.org] vocabulary in your wiki add in [[MediaWiki:Smw_import_schema|this page]] a subset of the [https://www.semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/MediaWiki:Smw_import_schema following list]. [https://www.semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Import_vocabulary Check here] to find out more.
pageproperties-form-section-semantic-pro: Here you can set semantic properties without having to manually annotate them on the page. Same properties can be used multiple times. Attention: the values of properties both manually annotated on the page or set through forms, and set here, will be merged together. To create/edit properties definition [[Special:PageProperties|go here]].
pageproperties-js-alert-2: Submitting the form will delete stored semantic properties, continue?
pageproperties-extension-desc: Allows to easily edit display title, language and content model of a page. To associate semantic properties to pages (provided that Semantic MediaWiki is installed), and to set arbitrary SEO meta tags for the entire wiki or specific pages
pageproperties-form-language-help: type a letter to scroll the select there
pageproperties-form-seo_entire_wiki-labe: apply to entire wiki (set values can be overwritten from other pages)
pageproperties-form-publish_as-help: attribution used for links from external pages
pageproperties-form-published-help: If unselected the page is considered a draft and will be not visible to regular visitors
pageproperties-form-seo_subpages-label: Sub-pages (apply to pages inlcuded in this page)
pageproperties-form-seo_subpages-help_: Select to let subpages inherit these values
pageproperties-form-section-seo-label: Here you can set arbitrary metadata for this page and its subpages. If the extension [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:WikiSEO WikiSEO] is installed, you can use the related parameters without the need to annotate them manually on the page.
pageproperties-form-section-main-label-e: Here you can set arbitrary metadata for this page, its subpages and even the entire wiki. If the extension [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:WikiSEO WikiSEO] is installed, you can use the related parameters without the need to annotate them manually on the page.
pageproperties-js-alert-1: Are you sure you want to delete this property?
